meanings.definition: A person or thing that assigns numbers.
meanings.sent1: The numberers at the library labeled each book with a unique code.
meanings.sent2: The numberers in the factory assigned serial numbers to the products.
meanings.sent3: The numberers at the zoo mistakenly labeled the giraffe enclosure as 'Elephant Zone'.
meanings.sent4: In the world of books, the ISBN system acts as a diligent numberers for publications.
meanings.sent5: The diligent numberers meticulously labeled each exhibit in the museum.

meanings.definition: A person who counts or calculates.
meanings.sent1: The numberers in the competition tallied the scores accurately.
meanings.sent2: The numberers in the accounting department ensured all expenses were accounted for.
meanings.sent3: The numberers at the bakery counted the freshly baked loaves with precision.
meanings.sent4: As a numberers of votes, she was trusted to provide accurate results.
meanings.sent5: The numberers in the math class calculated the sum of the numbers effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A device or tool used for numbering.
meanings.sent1: The antique printing press had intricate numberers for page identification.
meanings.sent2: The cashier used an electronic numberers to keep track of sales.
meanings.sent3: The automatic ticket numberers at the train station sometimes malfunctioned.
meanings.sent4: The clock's rotating numberers displayed the time in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The mechanical numberers stamped each document with precision.
